data.title: Markov Best Guess
data.statement:
Based on Markov chains, you must find the missing letters of an incomplete phrase, using a reference phrase.
The missing characters are represented by '_'
You must return the reconstructed phrase.

The way to proceed is to identify which is the most frequent letter after another one
In the phrase "Hello world." for example here are the probabilities:
{
    "H": {"e": 1.0},
    "e": {"l": 1.0},
    "l": {"l": 0.333, "o": 0.333, "d": 0.333},
    "o": {" ": 0.5, "r": 0.5},
    " ": {"w": 1.0},
    "w": {"o": 1.0},
    "r": {"l": 1.0},
    "d": {".": 1.0}
}
You can now reconstruct "H_llo w_r_d." by using the best guess for the next character of that table.

/!\ Important /!\
This puzzle doesn't require to use more than one previous character to predict the next one. (It could change the reconstruction)
There's always a single answer to reconstruct a missing character.
There will never be two consecutive missing characters.
Every character must be considered except from '_'.
